title: Prepare Ingredients
definition: Gather all necessary ingredients for making Pasta Carbonara, including pasta (such as spaghetti or spaghettoni), eggs (using yolks or a combination of whole eggs and yolks), pecorino romano cheese, optionally Parmigiano Reggiano cheese, black pepper, and guanciale or bacon/pancetta as a substitute. Ensure all ingredients are fresh and ready for use. Optionally, prepare tools like a cheese grater and pepper grinder.

title: Cook Pasta
definition: Boil water in a large pot, add salt, and cook the pasta until it is al dente. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking. Reserve some pasta water before draining.

title: Cook Meat
definition: Cut the guanciale, pancetta, or bacon into small pieces. Cook it in a pan over medium heat until it is crispy and the fat is rendered. Optionally, start with a cold pan to render fat slowly. Remove from heat and let it cool slightly. Optionally, reserve some cooked meat for garnish.

title: Mix Sauce
definition: In a bowl, combine egg yolks (or a combination of whole eggs and yolks) with grated pecorino romano cheese and freshly ground black pepper. Mix until smooth. Optionally, add Parmigiano Reggiano cheese. Add a small amount of reserved pasta water to achieve a creamy consistency.

title: Combine Ingredients
definition: Add the cooked pasta directly to the pan with the cooked meat. Pour the egg and cheese mixture over the pasta and meat, stirring quickly to coat the pasta without scrambling the eggs. Use the residual heat to cook the eggs gently. Add more pasta water if needed to create a creamy sauce.

title: Finish Dish
definition: Plate the Pasta Carbonara, ensuring it is evenly coated with the sauce. Finish with additional grated cheese and black pepper to taste before serving. Optionally, add reserved crispy meat as garnish.
